But if you head here during a nice night, then wait for a patio seat. This area is always packed, mainly because you're sitting right over the water. They also have a boat dock so you can watch the boaters stroll up to grab some din din. You may have to wait for a patio seat, but it's well worth it.  The food here isn't anything spectacular, but it's definitely above average. They have all your steak specialties, duh...the name, along with some other good stuff you'd see on most steakhouse menus. People flock to this place on weekend nights, along with most week nights, so you know the food has to be good to keep them coming back. And while you'll spend a decent chunk of change, it's well worth it if you're sitting outside with a view.  T Bones on the Lake is great for a spring or summer night, when it isn't too hot & you're looking for good food. They have a good menu, but the main attraction is the lake. So if you're in the area or have a boat, pull up to the dock & find a patio seat.
The worst service ... most rude management ... and overpriced food I've ever eaten ... Wouldn't recommend ... only thing good this place has going for it is the location on the lake!

First of all if the service is very slow takes forever to get a cheeseburger on the cheeseburger hit the table it was room temperature and it was very plain the views nice but you're just paying for the view you not paying for the services the food anything.. I will never come back to this restaurant again unless the owner died and I came to pay respects to make sure he doesn't open another restaurant again

Great place to pull up to in your boat and get a drink on the deck and watch people navigate the traffic jam of finding a boat slip on a busy summer day. The food is ok. They market it as a Texas place and while the memorabilia decor inside is true Texan the food is only ok. All in all not a bad place to hang out on a summer day.

T-Bones on the Lake   The name sounds "Elite" but nope it's a basic restaurant with basic bar/pub foods. The wine selection is very basic & I was disappointed. If they add local wines to the menu that may enhance the experience. The service is mediocre.   Sitting on the lake sipping & watching the water view is relaxing. If you're coming for the food DO NOT EXPECT anything but bar food.   The Top Shelf Margarita was good ~~ was

Let's get it out of the way - the food here is not so great. Nothing so terrible it has scarred my memory but if I never ate here again I wouldn't be fussed. We have tried various plates and the best sampled was the popcorn shrimp and the appetizer sampler. The salads have come with slightly wilted lettuce and browning avocado.  The sandwiches are average.   Obviously I don't come here for the food. I come for the sunshine and friendly wait staff. Also to visit my various duck and fish friends that I have made by throwing them my leftover crackers from the deck. The deck they have out back is perfect for enjoying a beer with friends. Or, if you are brave, a top shelf margarita. I only ordered it once so either I got a heavy handed bartender or it is how they normally make the drink but after just one I was pretty relaxed and glad I wasn't driving.   I would recommend coming here just for drinks on the lake and maybe an appetizer. I haven't tried their steaks but if you can't provide a fresh salad I don't see a reason to gamble on the higher priced items.

Service was good, but food NOT.  You don't realize how awful the food really is until about 30 minutes after you have eaten it.  5 of us eat there tonight, we each had different items, pasta, fish and chips, potato skins, combination of vegetable sides, a sandwich, and other items.   Everything was GREAZY and salty.  But you don't realize how much grease until 15-30 minutes after eating when your skin gets oily, you feel sludgy, thirsty, and loose your energy.  I don't know what grease or ingredients they use, but it's terrible.  We all went home after and didn't feel like doing anything after this. I've been there before for beer on the deck, the beer is good, but don't eat the food.   Contrary to many of the other reviews, the service was very good.  Meghan was our waitress.
Ok Food, nothing spectacular. Good casual food on the lake. Would visit again, but average.

Bad food, bad service and a pushy bartender. This is the only place on Lake Wylie that you can have a drink and eat. I have given this place over 6 tries and it sinks, there is no saving it. Last trip was my last. Pushy  bartender stuck a drink in front of me that I did not order. She was totally obnoxious.  I never have had a good meal here and everything is overpriced. We went on a Friday night to hear their band and have a drink. What a joke. I have never seen so many mentality deprived people and the band could not carry a tune in a bucket.

We recently moved to the Steel Creek area of Charlotte and were riding around hunting for a place to eat dinner when we passed T-Bones Steakhouse and Saloon on 49 and saw a sign that said all you can eat shrimp.  We decided to give it a try.  From the moment we pulled in the parking lot it felt all wrong.  The long wooden covered walkways to the door were weird and felt SO old school.  Then when we get to a door, we enter a long waiting area with weird art and knick knacks everywhere to look at while you wait for a table.  This was a Tuesday night and there were very few people there so we walked on through to the main entrance door where we encountered a huge polar bear in a glass case.  I guess some people like this sort of decoration... but I think polar bears should not be in glass cases and it makes me sad to see that sort of thing.  But, I went on in to the cavernous building to be greeted by an older man that seemed to be one of the managers if not an owner.  He was nice enough but felt very seventies to me; like he's had a very colorful, entertaining past in his youth and now leads a comfortable life complete with gold chains and tight fitting jeans.  The booths are fixed to the wall, meaning if you're fat, you're gonna be very tightly squeezed to get in or out of the booth.  The server seemed used to making her money off the alcohol sales, so since we didn't drink, we rarely saw her.  The food was average at best.  Fried popcorn shrimp, baked potato, cole slaw...  very usual and unfortunately, not super tasty.  The best part of my meal was the loaded baked potato and the sweet tea...  I was sad when both were gone.  Looking around the place you can tell that if you enjoy rowdy drunken (Jimmy Buffet type) fun on a river then it's the spot to be at during the summer months, complete with boat docks, a huge outdoor bar area and tons of space inside to hold lots of drinkers.  The place reminded me of an old saloon on Gunsmoke with 2 levels and lots of hallways darting off that you couldn't see where they went.  I kept expecting to see a "working" girl leading a man down one of those halls.  None of it said "tasty food" or "comfort" to me...  the whole place felt like those walls have seen way too much action over the years.  The energy of the place was not enjoyable to me; I will not be back.
Great live music last Friday night, July 31st, with Richburg Road.  Good dance music, excellent play list, good tunes to just sit back and listen to, also.  Made for a fun evening.

What's better than fresh seafood, warm weather and lake view?? This place was heaven, right on the water, outdoor seating, great drinks and good seafood.  Being from out of town we had no idea what to expect and found the spot on Yelp.  The service was far from being A1, slow and way too laid back.   This place seemed like a hidden gem on the lake but the horrid customer service well lack there of, makes me not want to go back again.
Stopped in for lunch today. The ratings are accurate. Mediocre food, place smelled "off" and looked dirty. There's got to be a better place to eat on the water. I won't be back.

Go here for the lake scenery-- not the food. Very mediocre. Nothing special. I had the smothered steak and would not get it again.  The inside is fun with signs and trinkets. The outside patio is nice to sit out and watch the lake. The waitresses were friendly.

I just noticed the time and they close in four minutes let me tell you they should have closed years ago and they should not bother opening tomorrow. I can't believe even a low-level restaurant can ruin an easy grilled chicken salad. The raspberry vinaigrette tasted like something out of one of those mayonnaise packets that you rip open. The chicken was grizzly bland and flavorless. The turtle that we saw in the pond as we were walking in probably would have tasted better. I was not the only patron who appeared to have trouble with their order. I saw two ladies at another table send back two plates of food. Simply because of the view I would only go there for a drink. Even the menus felt dirty and sticky and that should have been my first clue. I was afraid to order another beer because of the scowl on the barmaids face I thought maybe she was going to yell at me. My pitbull has a softer look on her face. If you like bad food you're in for a heckuva time.
Rookie operation all around. So-so food, Less than so-so service. Smelly and generally sub-par. Go to drink on the deck ONLY.
Looking for a NC it SC craft beer. You won't find it here. Terrible beer selection. Bud Sam Adams Land Shark aren't real beer. You can do better or just take handouts from the distributors.

Wanted to check this place out, never been.  First impressions horrible.  Not a very "welcoming" place.  When I pulled up looked like all the cooks in the kitchen were outside smoking a cigarette.  By the looks of it I doubt they washed their hands.  Outside seating is seat yourself.  I sat for about five minutes, every sever outside just looked at me and finally I had to ask if it was serve yourself Thursday.  Only had one beer and left.  Did not want to eat there.
The waitresses are extremely rude and the food is cold and something you might find at a fast food joint. Don't waste your time unless you're out on the lake and have no other option.
Everyone at our table loved our dishes which included the grilled chicken, tender ribs, and calabash shrimp. Yummy!

The view! Love to watch the boats on the lake-have to be seated in the deck. Why anyone eats inside is a mystery to me. This place is all about location-you do not come here for the food. The food is okay-not horrible-the salads are good. You come here to view the lake, people watch, and drink.   Always meet fun, talkative people. Very casual. Car Parking lot is good and the boat dock seems adequate. The kids like the ducks and turtles that hang around. They have pellet machines for a quarter to feed the rascals.

The food is not great.  The service is hit or miss.  It is however a great place to go on an afternoon for drinks and appetizers.   Bring out of state visitors who enjoy the novelty of the patio.  Would not consider this place without company.  We would not go on a weekend  night especially during the hot summer months...young kids meat market....not interested in that atmosphere.
This place is a waste of time. Had enough of the crappy customer service, food and management to ever come back again. If only Sweetwater could takeover their location.
This place never disappoints! Awesome view right on the lake, delicious food EVERY time (no matter what you order, and great wait staff!
The restaurant is dirty, the service is poor and the food is sub-par. The only redeeming factor is the deck.

Great place on the water in South Carolina. My wife and I are from Illinois, we visit South Carolina to be with family, every time we visit we stop at T-Bones for some drinks. We love the old decor with something interesting to see at every turn. The outside patio is amazing in the summertime.
Man, if there was another game on the lake, these guys may actually step up their game. Food is average. Inside is dark and dreary. Outside is ok. Love the lake fire though.

As everyone that goes to TBones remarks, WHY DON'T THEY UPDATE THE DECOR AND MENU IN THE WINTER WHEN IT IS SLOW???  The only draw TBones has is the location (only place on lake really - that is a shame) and the bartenders who do a great job of serving from dilapidated old bars and a crowd in warm weather.  The deck is great, but needs to be scraped and repained, updated.  The furniture on the deck is the cheapest they can find, and is just uncomfortable and always broken. The stools make you sit way lower than the bar and you feel like a 5 year old - they weren't made for this.  They are breaking too.The horrible 'decorative' paint job and poly on the bar and railings from 20+ years ago is peeling off and needs to be removed.  Looks like the removed a lot from the interior ceiling of deck bar, which is great because it was nasty hanging over where drinks were made.  I know they probably can't expand deck, but no reason they cannot update it in the current footprint.  Food just isn't great, never has been.  Work on the menu and find people committed to putting out good product, revamp the old, tired decor and clean up the restrooms, and you won't have a slow season...
Great food, live music and its all on the lake. Be sure to give this place a chance and always go at the evening.

1 star for the view of the lake and 1 star for the food and drinks. We sat on the outside patio and everything was sticky. It took the waiter 15 minites to come and take our drink order only to have those drinks come out 30 minutes later (although he did apologize) and tables that came in after us had their drinks in 5 minutes or so.

Ate here on a Friday afternoon and it was pretty busy but we were sat immediately.  The decor is rustic but the location is where this place shines. It's right on the water with plenty of boat parking!  It's also right next to the boat launch. There is outside seating available.  We had the potato skins app.  They were good but not awesome. Plenty of sour cream was provided.  I had the Flounder sandwich with fries.  It was also good... there was only one piece of fish but it pretty much covered the sub roll shaped bun. I wish it was a bit thicker.  The bread was quite fresh.  Tarter sauce was tasty and I would guess to be made in-house.  My brother had the parmesan crusted chicken breast with fries and he said it was great!  Our server did an excellent job... we had been outside and were parched and it was warn inside the restaurant so we were hitting the water pretty hard but she kept us hydrated ;-)  We will definitely return the next time we visit Lake Wylie.

Damn it! If I win the lottery this is the first place I'm going to buy and turn around... like this could be one of those places they feature on Drive in, Dinners, and Dives. I think they make so much on beer sales they don't really have to make good food. It's one of the few places on the lake so...scenery is nice though.
Went for brunch. French toast was like rocks, eggs and sausage were cold. We were told they would be putting out fresh food, that was cold too! $30 for two for brunch, not worth it.

Had the chicken salad and lettuce was wilted, fruit was  room temp.  Chicken wings where not hot.  Husband got a sandwich and lettuce had dirt on it. Was never washed. Wow, the location is great food is crap..
Great location, especially in good weather.  The food on the other hand is a disappointment.  The service isn't great either.  Seems like a waste to have a prime location without good food.

This place is truly horrid. Just not my kind of place. I went as part of a group so did not really have a choice. It was hot - very uncomfortable - inside. It was loud - very loud - as usual. The staff is very friendly so that's why they get 2 stars. The owners do nothing to attempt fixing it up.   The food isn't very good at all. The chicken nachos we ordered I have renamed the Waldo Chicken Nachos as in - where's Waldo?!  We went into the parrot bar after our quick apps and a live band was playing. The live band was very good but I never have, nor never will understand why small places have the bands play their music so loud. I mean incredibly loud.   Maybe I'm just an old "fuddy duddy" but how can that be enjoyable?  You cannot easily carry on a conversation with the people you are with.   Each time I go here I swear it will be the last. How are there no other restaurants on Lake Wylie?!

Where to begin.....The only reason to go to this place is the view. To sit out by the water and have a beer. The food is the worst. You would think being the only restaurant on the lake you would feel some since of obligation to have great food. McDonald's is five star dinning compared to this place. It really ails me that this place sucks. On the weekend your on the lake, you want to pull your boat up and go in and have a great meal and a few beers. Not happening.
Eat before you go, nice deck and beer is sometimes cold..good location, really wish this place was better.
The food is awful. Drinks are weak. Service is terrible. Sunday brunch is good & there is a bloody mary bar.

I'm a fan of this place not only because it's minutes away from my house but for the scenery you can go on the back patio and eat while watching the view of the lake its a different kind of scenery i will say im not a fan of the food there its regular bar food i always get the same thing when i go which is the cat fish dinner that you can really split with two people its alot of food! The drink in my picture i was really excited about because it was so pretty in color but nothing to brag about almost a little watered down. I reccommend this place for going to hang out with friends for drinks maybe or a loved one just for the patio  on the lake in back its a great vibe! Which i believe they shut that part of the restraunt down when the cold weather starts to kick in which makes sense. Also when you walk in i like the big scary bear in the glass case you see in the pictures as well makes for a good picture.

Had two very disappointing dinners here. Although the location and view of the lake is 5 stars, the food is not. I went with a group of four. Our waitress was nice but not very professional. One of the first things we spotted was a large cock roach crawling across the floor. We expected this to be taken care of after telling the waitress but it was not. I am not so sure where that nasty bug ended up. For about $17-$19 a a dinner our plates were very sad looking. Chicken was dry and the portions were tiny! Going to t bones you may be thinking oh! T bone steaks! Nope...no where to be found on the menu. Mostly everything is fried! After finally receiving our bread and butter at the same time as our dinner....?? We dug right in. After one person took a bite the sour faces were hard to miss!! After investigating the bread and butter we realized that there was something seriously wrong with the butter! It tasted something like chlorine/really old water that has been sitting in a dirty sink for a long time. It was terrible. After kindly explaining this to my waitress she again was not very professional. She was like oh okay. And took it from us. She offered free desert which we did not want because everything else was terrible.
